title: Strategies for Utilizing Computer Conferences for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary Education Curriculum and Basic Digital Tool Usage Experience
context.additional_context: Conducting computer-based collaborative learning in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment, with a focus on social studies-integrated activities. Aims for continuous improvement through formative assessment-driven feedback.

learning_goals: Preservice teachers can identify and explain at least three effective collaborative learning strategies in computer conferences.
Preservice teachers can design and implement interaction scenarios between teachers and learners using smartphone-based tools.
Preservice teachers can diagnose and analyze issues (e.g., accessibility, engagement) occurring in technological environments and propose improvement plans.

resources: Social Studies Curriculum-Integrated Case Study Resource Book
Smartphone App-Based Collaboration Tools (e.g., Google Classroom, KakaoTalk Team Chat)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
